column4: Hey guys, anyone know much about compiling from source? I am having weird issue, posted on the forums, the link is http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=1598503
Really? im following the instructions at http://www.opera.com/linux/docs/plugins/install/#mplayer
whould be in the readme
I followed the readme and ensured I had what it wanted installed
its the --enable-x switch
The Opera tutorial says that is needed, whats wrong with it?
you know opera 9 is availible in the canical repos right?
I'm trying to get mplayer's plug in to work with opera, I already have opera installed
hrm... not really sure
just to test, I tried make, and it gives me errors and gives up
here are directions http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=179694&highlight=file+directory+error%3A+X11%2FIntrinsic.h%3A
np
Negative, had same errors
np
I'm going to post in the thread that you came to the rescue in irc :)
np  just put the link that worked that way more people will see it.

Dang, well it compiled, I copied over the right files into opera's plugin folder, but alas it still does not work (loading a page with embeded video results in a blank grey box where the video should be
maybe a codec problem
Even though mplayer works fine in firefox?
I'm not really sure how all that is working. But if it works outside it should work embedded.
would it be a codec problem even though mplayer works fine in firefox?
no  if it works in mplayer or with firefox it should work.  Thats odd I would maybe look for a support forum for the mplayerplug-in .
